com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags
Class DefineVideoStream

java.lang.Object
  com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.Tag
      com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.DefinitionTag
          com.jswiff.swfrecords.tags.DefineVideoStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class DefineVideoStream
extends DefinitionTag

This tag defines the format of a streaming video data contained in subsequent VideoFrame tags.

Since:
SWF 6
See Also:
VideoFrame, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DefineVideoStream

public DefineVideoStream(int characterId,
                         int numFrames,
                         int width,
                         int height,
                         byte deblocking,
                         boolean smoothing,
                         short codecId)
Creates a new DefineVideoStream tag. Supply the character ID, the number of frames (i.e. subsequent VideoFrame tags) and the dimensions of the video. Specify if a deblocking filter should be used at playback to reduce blocking artifacts (use DEBLOCKING_... constants) and whether to apply smoothing. Finally, specify which codec is used for video encoding. Supported codecs are Sorenson H.263 (an enhanced subset of ITU H.263v1) and, since SWF 7, Screen Video, a format optimized for screen captures in motion (use either CODEC_SORENSON_H263 or CODEC_SCREEN_VIDEO).

Parameters:
characterId - character ID of video
numFrames - number of video frames
width - video width in pixels
height - video height in pixels
deblocking - deblocking setting (on /off / use packet setting - see DEBLOCKING_... constants)
smoothing - if true, video is smoothed
codecId - video encoding algorithm (CODEC_SORENSON_H263 or CODEC_SCREEN_VIDEO)
Method Detail

getCodecId

public short getCodecId()
Returns the codec used for video encoding. Supported codecs are the Sorenson H.263 bitstream format (an enhanced subset of ITU H.263v1) and, as of SWF 7, the Screen Video bitstream format, a format optimized for screen captures in motion.

Returns:
video codec (CODEC_SORENSON_H263 or CODEC_SCREEN_VIDEO)

getDeblocking

public byte getDeblocking()
Checks the deblocking setting for the video, i.e. if a deblocking filter should be used at playback to reduce blocking artifacts and improve subjective visual quality.

Returns:
deblocking setting (one of the DEBLOCKING_... constants)

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Returns the height of the video in pixels.

Returns:
video height in px

getNumFrames

public int getNumFrames()
Returns the number of video frames, i.e. the number of VideoFrame tags following this video stream definition.

Returns:
video frame count

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Returns the width of the video in pixels.

Returns:
video width in px

isSmoothing

public boolean isSmoothing()
Checks whether smoothing is supposed to be applied to the video at playback.

Returns:
true if smoothing enabled, otherwise false

setCodecId

public void setCodecId(short codecId)
Sets the codec used for video encoding. Supported codecs are the Sorenson H.263 bitstream format (an enhanced subset of ITU H.263v1) and, as of SWF 7, the Screen Video bitstream format, a format optimized for screen captures in motion.

Parameters:
codecId - video codec (CODEC_SORENSON_H263 or CODEC_SCREEN_VIDEO)

setDeblocking

public void setDeblocking(byte deblocking)
Sets the deblocking setting for the video, i.e. if a deblocking filter should be used at playback to reduce blocking artifacts and improve subjective visual quality.

Parameters:
deblocking - deblocking setting (one of the DEBLOCKING_... constants)

setHeight

public void setHeight(int height)
Sets the height of the video in pixels.

Parameters:
height - video height in px

setNumFrames

public void setNumFrames(int numFrames)
Sets the number of video frames, i.e. the number of VideoFrame tags following this video stream definition.

Parameters:
numFrames - video frame count

setSmoothing

public void setSmoothing(boolean smoothing)
Specifies whether smoothing is supposed to be applied to the video at playback.

Parameters:
smoothing - true if smoothing enabled, otherwise false

setWidth

public void setWidth(int width)
Sets the width of the video in pixels.

Parameters:
width - video width in px
